io.codecastle.scriptorium.json

Class JsonObjectDocument

  • Object
    • JsonObjectDocument
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Inscribable<JsonObject<?>,JsonObjectDocument>, JsonObject<JsonObjectDocument>, Closeable, AutoCloseable

    public final class JsonObjectDocument
extends Object
    Represents a JSON object currently being output as a JSON document.
    See Also:
    Json.object(Appendable)

      • close

        public void close()
           throws IOException
        Closes this JSON object and any nested arrays, objects, or values that remain open.

        Subsequent calls to this method after the first on the same object have no effect.

        Specified by:
        close in interface Closeable
        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs

        public THIS withNull(CharSequence key)
              throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: JsonObject
        Appends a key to the JSON object with a null literal value and returns this object.

        The contents of the provided key will be double-quoted and escaped.

        If the provided key is null, this method has no effect.

        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        key - the key to append

      • with

        public THIS with(CharSequence key,
                 CharSequence value)
          throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: JsonObject
        Appends a key to the JSON object with a string literal value and returns this object.

        The contents of the provided key and value will be double-quoted and escaped.

        If the provided key is null, this method has no effect.

        If the provided value is null, a null literal value will be appended.

        Specified by:

      • key

        public JsonKey<THIS> key()
                  throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: JsonObject
        Begins a new key of this JSON object and returns a JsonKey object that can be used to append characters to it and assign it a value.

        Calling any of the overloads of the then method of the returned JsonKey object will return this object. Additionally, calling the JsonValue.then(), JsonArrayNode.then(), or JsonObjectNode.then() methods of JsonValue, JsonArrayNode, or JsonObjectNode objects returned by the returned JsonKey object's JsonKey.value(), JsonKey.array(), or JsonKey.object() methods will return this object.

        Calling any method of this object before any of the above-named methods of the returned JsonKey object or of the JsonValue, JsonArrayNode, or JsonObjectNode object it returns may result in invalid output and/or an unchecked exception.

        When this method returns, an opening double-quote (preceded by a comma, if appropriate) will have already been appended to the underlying Appendable.

        Specified by:
        key in interface JsonObject<THIS extends AbstractJsonObject<THIS>>
        Returns:
        a JsonKey representing a new key of this object
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs
        See Also:
        JsonObject.key(char), JsonObject.key(Character), JsonObject.key(CharSequence)

      • key

        public JsonKey<THIS> key(char key)
                  throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: JsonObject
        Begins a new key of this JSON object beginning with the provided character and returns a JsonKey object that can be used to append characters to it and assign it a value.

        Calling any of the overloads of the then method of the returned JsonKey object will return this object. Additionally, calling the JsonValue.then(), JsonArrayNode.then(), or JsonObjectNode.then() methods of JsonValue, JsonArrayNode, or JsonObjectNode objects returned by the returned JsonKey object's JsonKey.value(), JsonKey.array(), or JsonKey.object() methods will return this object.

        Calling any method of this object before any of the above-named methods of the returned JsonKey object or of the JsonValue, JsonArrayNode, or JsonObjectNode object it returns may result in invalid output and/or an unchecked exception.

        When this method returns, an opening bracket (preceded by a comma, if appropriate) and the provided character will have already been appended to the underlying Appendable. The provided character will be escaped.

        Specified by:
        key in interface JsonObject<THIS extends AbstractJsonObject<THIS>>
        Parameters:
        key - the first character of the new key
        Returns:
        a JsonKey representing a new key of this object
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs
        See Also:
        JsonObject.key(), JsonObject.key(Character), JsonObject.key(CharSequence)

      • key

        public JsonKey<THIS> key(CharSequence key)
                  throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: JsonObject
        Begins a new key of this JSON object beginning with the provided CharSequence and returns a JsonKey object that can be used to append characters to it and assign it a value.

        Calling any of the overloads of the then method of the returned JsonKey object will return this object. Additionally, calling the JsonValue.then(), JsonArrayNode.then(), or JsonObjectNode.then() methods of JsonValue, JsonArrayNode, or JsonObjectNode objects returned by the returned JsonKey object's JsonKey.value(), JsonKey.array(), or JsonKey.object() methods will return this object.

        Calling any method of this object before any of the above-named methods of the returned JsonKey object or of the JsonValue, JsonArrayNode, or JsonObjectNode object it returns may result in invalid output and/or an unchecked exception.

        The contents of the provided CharSequence will be escaped.

        If the provided CharSequence is null, nothing will be prepended to the element. I.e., when this method returns only an opening double-quote (preceded by a comma, if appropriate) will be appended to the underlying Appendable

        Specified by:
        key in interface JsonObject<THIS extends AbstractJsonObject<THIS>>
        Parameters:
        key - the first character of the new key
        Returns:
        a JsonKey representing a new key of this object
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs
        See Also:
        JsonObject.key(), JsonObject.key(Character), JsonObject.key(CharSequence)

      • inscribe

        public <T extends FluentNode<THIS>> T inscribe(IOFunction<? super THIS,T> function)
                                        throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: io.codecastle.scriptorium.Inscribable
        Inscribes another FluentNode in this object, and returns it.

        This method calls the provided function, passing this object as the input, and returns the output.

        When the FluentNode.then() method of the returned node is called, this object will be returned.

        When this object or a parent object is closed, the FluentNode returned by this method will also be closed if it has not already been.

        Specified by:
        inscribe in interface Inscribable<JsonObject<?>,THIS extends AbstractJsonObject<THIS>>
        Type Parameters:
        T - the inscription type
        Parameters:
        function - a function that returns a FluentNode whose parent is the function's argument
        Returns:
        the output of the provided function when called with this object as an argument
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • withIfPresent

        public THIS withIfPresent(CharSequence key,
                          Optional<?> optional)
                   throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: JsonObject
        If the provided Optional is not empty, appends a key to the JSON object with the value; then returns this object.

        Present CharSequence or Character values will be appended as double-quoted and escaped string literals.

        Present Byte, Short, Integer, Float, Long, Double, BigInteger, or BigDecimal values will be appended as numeric literals.

        Present Boolean values will be appended as Boolean value literals.

        Present values of any other type will result in an IllegalArgumentException.

        If optional is empty (if Optional.isPresent() returns false), or if the provided key is null, this method has no effect.

        Specified by:
        withIfPresent in interface JsonObject<THIS extends AbstractJsonObject<THIS>>
        Parameters:
        key - the key to append if the provided optional is present
        optional - an Optional optionally containing the value to append
        Returns:
        this object
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs
